body_html:
cuda + cudnn is fairly common though so it's not adding much of a requirement as it is typically strongly recommended if you have a gpu. That'd be my ideal option as that would both give a nicely optimized gpu implementation and as it is part of cudnn it'll likely remain actively maintained.

As a related note, in actually using ctc one useful function besides the loss would be a way of doing the beam search to find the most likely sequence. The loss by itself is still nice though as you can always just use the greedy method of choosing the most likely labels when doing the decoding.
